answers.answer: Diabetics are more prone to bladder infections, so you may want to ask her if she has any discomfort. If her glucose levels have been high, she may be feeling thirsty (symptom of uncontrolled diabetes is thirst) and may just be drinking too much because of it. See if the behavior changes when her glucose levels are normal. If not, it may not hurt to have her doctor run a test for bladder infection just to be safe.

question: My three-year-old daughter has had type 1 diabetes for a little over a year.  For several weeks she has been wetting her pants before she gets to the bathroom.  She complains of no pain but manages to only get to the bathroom after she has started in her pants.  We had several weeks where her blood sugars were not under control but as of the last few days they have leveled off.  Does anyon else have this problem or have you heard of these kinds of problems associated with diabetes?  Should I have her checked or do you think this may be more of a behavorial problem?
title: potty problems
